Class TCPServer

java.lang.Object
edu.io.net.server.tcp.TCPServer
public class TCPServer extends Object
Low-level TCP server responsible for accepting socket connections, handling raw client I/O and routing incoming Command objects to a higher-level command executor.

This class forms the transport layer of the architecture. It does not interpret or process commands itself; instead, it delegates all command logic to a handler registered via onCommand(BiFunction). Each connected client is represented by a Client instance that encapsulates input/output streams, a per-client semaphore and metadata such as connection timestamps.

Threading model

  • The server listens on the configured port using a blocking ServerSocket.
  • Each accepted Socket spawns a new virtual thread (`Thread.startVirtualThread`) responsible for communicating with one client.
  • Within each client thread, incoming serialized objects are read and passed to the configured command executor.
  • Outgoing messages are serialized using a per-client semaphore to prevent interleaving of ObjectOutputStream writes.

Command dispatching

Command routing is defined by the function BiFunction<Client, Command, CommandAck> provided through onCommand(BiFunction). If no executor is registered, all incoming messages produce CommandAck.NO_ACK.

Client management

Active clients are stored in a thread-safe ConcurrentHashMap keyed by their underlying Socket. The map is used for broadcasting messages and for higher-level game logic to associate server state with each client.

Error handling

When a client disconnects or an I/O error occurs, the corresponding client thread terminates. The disconnect is logged, and all further communication attempts for that client quietly stop.

Intended usage

This class is expected to be used as a supporting transport layer underneath a higher-level server (e.g., GameServer) which defines actual command semantics and game logic.

  • Constructor Details

    • TCPServer

      public TCPServer(int port)
      Creates a new TCP server bound to the specified port. Until a command executor is registered via onCommand(java.util.function.BiFunction<edu.io.net.server.tcp.Client, edu.io.net.command.Command, edu.io.net.command.CommandAck>), all incoming client messages will result in CommandAck.NO_ACK.
      Parameters:
      port - TCP port the server should listen on

  • Method Details

    • getClientBySocket

      public Optional<Client> getClientBySocket(Socket socket)
      Retrieves the Client instance associated with the given Socket, if it exists.

      This method allows looking up a connected client based on its underlying socket. If the socket is not currently registered with the server, an empty Optional is returned.

      Parameters:
      socket - the socket used to identify the client
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the associated Client, or Optional.empty() if no client is found for the given socket

    • onCommand

      public void onCommand(BiFunction<Client, Command, CommandAck> executeCommand)
      Registers the command executor function invoked for every incoming Command received from any connected client.

      The provided function must be thread-safe, as it may be invoked concurrently from multiple client threads.

      Parameters:
      executeCommand - a function mapping (client, command) to a CommandAck response

    • start

      public void start() throws IOException
      Starts the TCP server and begins accepting incoming client connections.

      For each accepted Socket, a new Client wrapper is created and a dedicated virtual thread is spawned to handle all communication with that client.

      This method blocks until the server socket is closed or an unrecoverable I/O error occurs.

      Throws:
      IOException - if the server socket cannot be opened or an error occurs while accepting connections

    • sendToClient

      public void sendToClient(Client client, Command cmd)
      Sends a command to the given client without registering any response handler.

      This is a convenience overload equivalent to calling sendToClient(Client, Command, BiConsumer) with a no-op response consumer.

      Parameters:
      client - the target client
      cmd - the command to send

    • sendToClient

      public void sendToClient(Client client, Command cmd, @NotNull @NotNull BiConsumer<Client, CommandRe> onResponse)
      Sends the given command asynchronously to a specific client.

      The send operation is executed on a newly created virtual thread. All writes to the client's ObjectOutputStream are serialized via the client's internal semaphore to prevent concurrent writes that could corrupt the stream.

      If the client later responds with a CommandAck containing a CommandRe, that response is matched by command ID and delivered to the provided onResponse handler.

      If an I/O error occurs during sending, the failure is silently ignored â€” the assumption being that the client has disconnected and the handler thread will already clean up.

      Parameters:
      client - the client to send the command to
      cmd - the command to send
      onResponse - callback invoked when a matching CommandRe is later received from the client

    • broadcast

      public void broadcast(Command cmd)
      Broadcasts the given command to all currently connected clients, ignoring all responses.

      This is a convenience overload of broadcast(Command, BiConsumer) using a no-op response handler.

      Parameters:
      cmd - the command to broadcast to all clients

    • broadcast

      public void broadcast(Command cmd, @NotNull @NotNull BiConsumer<Client, CommandRe> onResponse)
      Broadcasts the given command to all currently connected clients.

      Each client receives the message asynchronously via sendToClient(Client, Command, BiConsumer). The broadcast operation never blocks the calling thread.

      Any CommandRe responses sent back by individual clients are routed to the provided onResponse consumer together with the client that sent the response.

      Parameters:
      cmd - the command to broadcast
      onResponse - handler invoked for each client response
